cvrfdoc.document_title: Red Hat Security Advisory: Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh 1.0.10 openshift-istio-kiali-rhel7-operator-container security update
cvrfdoc.document_distribution: Copyright Â© 2021 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

full_product_name.product_name: openshift-istio-kiali-rhel7-operator-container-1.0.12-2 as a component of Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh 1.0

notes.note: kiali: JWT cookie uses default signing key

reference.description: bz#1810383: CVE-2020-1764 kiali: JWT cookie uses default signing key

remediation.description:
The OpenShift Service Mesh release notes provide information on the features and known issues:
https://docs.openshift.com/container-platform/4.3/service_mesh/servicemesh-release-notes.html

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank Dagan Henderson (Akoya, LLC) for reporting this issue.

note:
An update for openshift-istio-kiali-rhel7-operator-container is now available for Openshift Service Mesh 1.0.
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh is Red Hat's distribution of the Istio service mesh project, tailored for installation into an on-premise OpenShift Container Platform installation.
Security Fix(es):
* kiali: JWT cookie uses default signing key (CVE-2020-1764)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
